frame.name: Familiarity
frame.definition:
<def-root>An <fen>Entity</fen> is presented as having been seen or experienced by a (typically generic and backgrounded) <fen>Cognizer</fen> on a certain number of occasions, causing the <fen>Entity</fen> to have a certain degree of recognizability for the <fen>Cognizer</fen>.
<ex><fex name="Entity">Susanna Fulton's work</fex> <m>is</m> <t>new</t> <fex name="Cognizer">to me</fex>.</ex>
<ex><fex name="Entity">Two of these frames</fex> <m>were</m> <t>new</t> <fex name="cog">to me</fex> <fex name="Role">as a beginning professor</fex>.</ex>
<ex><fex name="ent">This</fex> <m>was</m> <fex name="deg">as</fex> <t>new</t> <fex name="cog">to him</fex> <fex name="deg">as the rest of the outcity</fex>.</ex>
<ex><fex name="ent">JSON</fex> <m>is</m> <fex name="deg">fairly</fex> <t>new</t> <fex name="cog">to me</fex> <fex name="Role">as a data format</fex>.</ex>
<ex>Moreover, <fex name="Entity">this way of describing and categorizing architecture</fex> <m>is</m> <t>familiar</t> <fex name="Cognizer">to most people</fex>.</ex>
<ex><fex name="Entity">Coronaviruses</fex> <m>are</m> not <t>unfamiliar</t> <fex name="Cognizer">to the epidemiological world</fex>.</ex>
<ex>Abbey Stadium will bring us into contact with one <t>familiar</t> <fex name="Entity">face</fex> at least.</ex></def-root>

FE.name: Entity
FE.definition:
<def-root>A concrete thing or abstract phenomenon or fact that is assessed in terms of how well recognizable it is to a <fen>Cognizer</fen>.
<ex>He gave <fex name="ent">an address</fex> quite <t>familiar</t> to the chauffeur.</ex></def-root>

FE.name: Cognizer
FE.definition:
<def-root>The (typically non-specific and backgrounded) sentient being for whom the <fen>Entity</fen> possesses a specified level of recognizability.
<ex>The information used to illustrate the concept is <t>familiar</t> <fex name="Cognizer">to the reader</fex>.</ex></def-root>

FE.name: Degree
FE.definition:
<def-root>The deviation of the actual level of recognizability of the <fen>Entity</fen> from the level specified by the target.
<ex>He gave an address <fex name="Degree">quite</fex> <t>familiar</t> to the chauffeur.</ex></def-root>

FE.name: Role
FE.definition:
<def-root>This FE identifies the role filled by a particular participant of the clause headed by the target. In so doing, it relates the specification of a level of familiarity to another background state of affairs by indicating that one of the role fillers of the current frame also fills a second kind of role in the background, either generically or in some specific instance.
<ex>I wanted to go with what was <t>familiar</t> to me <fex name="Role">as an artist</fex>.</ex></def-root>

FE.name: Depictive
FE.definition: <def-root>This FE describes the <fen>Cognizer</fen> as being in some state during the event.</def-root>

FE.name: Context
FE.definition: <def-root>A situation or source from which the <fex name="Entity">Entity</fex> is made more recognizanble to the <fex name="Cognizer">Cognizer</fex>.</def-root>

lexUnit.name: unfamiliar.a
lexUnit.definition: COD: not known or recognized; uncharacteristic

lexUnit.name: know.v
lexUnit.definition: COD: be familiar or friendly with.

lexUnit.name: ken.n
lexUnit.definition: COD: one's range of knowledge or sight.
